pros: Good place to work, good hours and fair wages

job_title: Group Home Worker in Saskatoon, SK
pros: Feeling like you are making a difference in some children’s lives.
cons: Terrible co workers and nepotism. Expect workers to be on call 24/7 Terrible reactions to sick calls. Illegal staffing to child ratios.

pros: Wonderful clients. Good hours. That’s it
cons: Management has horrible attitudes. Management treats clients like crap. Building is dirty and always has bugs in the warmer months. Money is mishandled. 85% of the staff are family of the president.

job_title: Emergency Receiving Home Child Care Worker in Saskatoon, SK
pros:
The pay is decent 19.23 and with covid, a bonus 3$ on top

Kids are amazing if you treat them with respect and nicely which they deserve but other staff always yelled at them and talked down to them.
cons:
They fire ppl for no reason (labor board got me my 2 weeks pay from there as they let me no for no reason), they mainly hire family so favouritism and they allow them to do what they wxjt with no repercussions (coworker left work without permission to go pick up her charger someone accidentally took home when I offered her mine from my purse when you need 2 workers on shift put house, they didn’t get in crap, I got fired for reporting it as “bullying” and she’s related to one manager, the secretary, and a few others). They communicate through text only, very unprofessional.

Encouraged yo eat with the kids but it’s all frozen, greasy foods 

They never had the social workers buy the kids clothes etc so staff would as they were wearing sweats and hoodies in + 30 weather
